member.name: T:MigrationTools.Processors.CreateTeamFolders
member.summary: Creates folders in Sared Queries for each Team

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Processors.ExportProfilePictureFromADProcessorOptions.Username
member.summary: The user name of the user that is used to export the pictures.

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Processors.ExportProfilePictureFromADProcessorOptions.Password
member.summary: The password of the user that is used to export the pictures.

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Processors.ExportProfilePictureFromADProcessorOptions.PictureEmpIDFormat
member.summary: TODO: You wpuld need to customise this for your system. Clone repo and run in Debug

member.name: T:MigrationTools.Processors.ExportUsersForMappingProcessor
member.summary: ExportUsersForMappingContext is a tool used to create a starter mapping file for users between the source and target systems. Use `ExportUsersForMappingConfig` to configure.

member.name: T:MigrationTools.Processors.FakeProcessor
member.summary: Note: this is only for internal usage. Don't use this in your configurations.

member.name: T:MigrationTools.Processors.ImportProfilePictureProcessor
member.summary: Downloads corporate images and updates TFS/Azure DevOps profiles

member.name: T:MigrationTools.Processors.TestConfigurationsMigrationProcessor
member.summary: This processor can migrate `test configuration`. This should be run before `LinkMigrationConfig`.

member.name: T:MigrationTools.Processors.TestPlansAndSuitesMigrationProcessor
member.summary: Rebuilds Suits and plans for Test Cases migrated using the WorkItemMigration

member.name: M:MigrationTools.Processors.TestPlansAndSuitesMigrationProcessor.ApplyConfigurations(Microsoft.TeamFoundation.TestManagement.Client.ITestSuiteEntry,Microsoft.TeamFoundation.TestManagement.Client.ITestSuiteEntry)
member.summary: Apply configurations to a single test case entry on the target, by copying from the source

member.name: M:MigrationTools.Processors.TestPlansAndSuitesMigrationProcessor.ApplyDefaultConfigurations(Microsoft.TeamFoundation.TestManagement.Client.ITestSuiteBase,Microsoft.TeamFoundation.TestManagement.Client.ITestSuiteBase)
member.summary: Sets default configurations on migrated test suites.
member.param: The test suite to take as a source.
The test suite to apply the default configurations to.

member.name: M:MigrationTools.Processors.TestPlansAndSuitesMigrationProcessor.FixWorkItemIdInQuery(Microsoft.TeamFoundation.TestManagement.Client.ITestSuiteBase)
member.summary: Fix work item ID's in query based suites

member.name: M:MigrationTools.Processors.TestPlansAndSuitesMigrationProcessor.GetTargetIdentity(Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Framework.Client.IdentityDescriptor)
member.summary: Retrieve the target identity for a given source descriptor

member.name: M:MigrationTools.Processors.TestPlansAndSuitesMigrationProcessor.RemoveInvalidLinks(Microsoft.TeamFoundation.TestManagement.Client.ITestPlan)
member.summary: Remove invalid links
member.remarks: VSTS cannot store some links which have an invalid URI Scheme. You will get errors like "The URL specified has a potentially unsafe URL protocol" For myself, the issue were urls that pointed to TFVC: "vstfs:///VersionControl/Changeset/19415" Unfortunately the API does not seem to allow access to the "raw" data, so there's nowhere to retrieve this as far as I can find. Should take care of https://github.com/nkdAgility/azure-devops-migration-tools/issues/178
member.param: The plan to remove invalid links drom

member.name: T:MigrationTools.Processors.TestVariablesMigrationProcessor
member.summary: This processor can migrate test variables that are defined in the test plans / suites. This must run before `TestPlansAndSuitesMigrationConfig`.

member.name: T:MigrationTools.Processors.TfsSharedQueryProcessor
member.summary: The TfsSharedQueryProcessor enabled you to migrate queries from one locatio nto another.

member.name: M:MigrationTools.Processors.TfsSharedQueryProcessor.MigrateFolder(Microsoft.TeamFoundation.WorkItemTracking.Client.QueryHierarchy,Microsoft.TeamFoundation.WorkItemTracking.Client.QueryFolder,Microsoft.TeamFoundation.WorkItemTracking.Client.QueryFolder)
member.summary: Define Query Folders under the current parent
member.param: The object that represents the whole of the target query tree
The source folder in tree on source instance
The target folder in tree on target instance

member.name: M:MigrationTools.Processors.TfsSharedQueryProcessor.MigrateQuery(Microsoft.TeamFoundation.WorkItemTracking.Client.QueryHierarchy,Microsoft.TeamFoundation.WorkItemTracking.Client.QueryDefinition,Microsoft.TeamFoundation.WorkItemTracking.Client.QueryFolder)
member.summary: Add Query Definition under a specific Query Folder.
member.param: The object that represents the whole of the target query tree
Query Definition - Contains the Query Details

member.name: T:MigrationTools.Processors.TfsSharedQueryProcessorOptions
member.summary: The `TfsSharedQueryProcessor` enabled you to migrate queries from one location to another.

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Processors.TfsSharedQueryProcessorOptions.PrefixProjectToNodes
member.summary: Do we add the source project name into the folder path

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Processors.TfsSharedQueryProcessorOptions.SharedFolderName
member.summary: The name of the shared folder, made a parameter incase it every needs to be edited

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Processors.TfsSharedQueryProcessorOptions.SourceToTargetFieldMappings
member.summary: Mapping of the source to the target

member.name: T:MigrationTools.Processors.TfsTeamSettingsProcessor
member.summary: Native TFS Processor, does not work with any other Endpoints.

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Processors.TfsTeamSettingsProcessorOptions.MigrateTeamSettings
member.summary: Migrate original team settings after their creation on target team project

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Processors.TfsTeamSettingsProcessorOptions.UpdateTeamSettings
member.summary: Reset the target team settings to match the source if the team exists

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Processors.TfsTeamSettingsProcessorOptions.PrefixProjectToNodes
member.summary: Prefix your iterations and areas with the project name. If you have enabled this in `NodeStructuresMigrationConfig` you must do it here too.

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Processors.TfsTeamSettingsProcessorOptions.MigrateTeamCapacities
member.summary: Migrate original team member capacities after their creation on the target team project. Note: It will only migrate team member capacity if the team member with same display name exists on the target collection otherwise it will be ignored.

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Processors.TfsTeamSettingsProcessorOptions.Teams
member.summary: List of Teams to process. If this is `null` then all teams will be processed.

member.name: T:MigrationTools.Processors.TfsWorkItemMigrationProcessor
member.summary: WorkItemMigrationConfig is the main processor used to Migrate Work Items, Links, and Attachments. Use `WorkItemMigrationConfig` to configure.

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Processors.TfsWorkItemMigrationProcessorOptions.UpdateCreatedDate
member.summary: If this is enabled the creation process on the target project will create the items with the original creation date. (Important: The item history is always pointed to the date of the migration, it's change only the data column CreateDate, not the internal create date)

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Processors.TfsWorkItemMigrationProcessorOptions.UpdateCreatedBy
member.summary: If this is enabled the creation process on the target project will create the items with the original creation date. (Important: The item history is always pointed to the date of the migration, it's change only the data column CreateDate, not the internal create date)

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Processors.TfsWorkItemMigrationProcessorOptions.WIQLQuery
member.summary: A work item query based on WIQL to select only important work items. To migrate all leave this empty. See [WIQL Query Bits](#wiql-query-bits)
member.default: SELECT [System.Id] FROM WorkItems WHERE [System.TeamProject] = @TeamProject AND [[System.WorkItemType] NOT IN ('Test Suite', 'Test Plan','Shared Steps','Shared Parameter','Feedback Request') ORDER BY [System.ChangedDate] desc

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Processors.TfsWorkItemMigrationProcessorOptions.FixHtmlAttachmentLinks
P:MigrationTools.Processors.TfsWorkItemMigrationProcessorOptions.WorkItemCreateRetryLimit
member.summary: **beta** If set to a number greater than 0 work items that fail to save will retry after a number of seconds equal to the retry count. This allows for periodic network glitches not to end the process.

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Processors.TfsWorkItemMigrationProcessorOptions.FilterWorkItemsThatAlreadyExistInTarget
member.summary: This loads all of the work items already saved to the Target and removes them from the Source work item list prior to commencing the run. While this may take some time in large data sets it reduces the time of the overall migration significantly if you need to restart.

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Processors.TfsWorkItemMigrationProcessorOptions.PauseAfterEachWorkItem
member.summary: Pause after each work item is migrated

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Processors.TfsWorkItemMigrationProcessorOptions.AttachRevisionHistory
member.summary: This will create a json file with the revision history and attach it to the work item. Best used with `MaxRevisions` or `ReplayRevisions`.

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Processors.TfsWorkItemMigrationProcessorOptions.GenerateMigrationComment
member.summary: If enabled, adds a comment recording the migration

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Processors.TfsWorkItemMigrationProcessorOptions.WorkItemIDs
member.summary: A list of work items to import

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Processors.TfsWorkItemMigrationProcessorOptions.MaxGracefulFailures
member.summary: The maximum number of failures to tolerate before the migration fails. When set above zero, a work item migration error is logged but the migration will continue until the number of failed items reaches the configured value, after which the migration fails.

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Processors.TfsWorkItemMigrationProcessorOptions.SkipRevisionWithInvalidIterationPath
member.summary: This will skip a revision if the source iteration has not been migrated i.e. it was deleted

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Processors.TfsWorkItemMigrationProcessorOptions.SkipRevisionWithInvalidAreaPath
member.summary: When set to true, this setting will skip a revision if the source area has not been migrated, has been deleted or is somehow invalid, etc.

member.name: T:MigrationTools.Processors.WorkItemBulkEditProcessor
member.summary: This processor allows you to make changes in place where we load from teh Target and update the Target. This is used for bulk updates with the most common reason being a process template change.

member.name: T:MigrationTools.Processors.WorkItemDeleteProcessor
member.summary: The `WorkItemDelete` processor allows you to delete any amount of work items that meet the query. **DANGER:** This is not a recoverable action and should be use with extream caution.

member.name: T:MigrationTools.Processors.WorkItemPostProcessingProcessor
member.summary: Reapply field mappings after a migration. Does not migtate Work Items, only reapplied changes to filed mappings.

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Processors.WorkItemPostProcessingProcessorOptions.WorkItemIDs
member.summary: A list of work items to import

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Processors.WorkItemPostProcessingProcessorOptions.WIQLQuery
member.summary: A work item query based on WIQL to select only important work items. To migrate all leave this empty. See [WIQL Query Bits](#wiql-query-bits)
member.default: AND [Microsoft.VSTS.Common.ClosedDate] = '' AND [System.WorkItemType] NOT IN ('Test Suite', 'Test Plan','Shared Steps','Shared Parameter','Feedback Request')

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Processors.WorkItemPostProcessingProcessorOptions.FilterWorkItemsThatAlreadyExistInTarget
member.summary: This loads all of the work items already saved to the Target and removes them from the Source work item list prior to commencing the run. While this may take some time in large data sets it reduces the time of the overall migration significantly if you need to restart.

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Processors.WorkItemPostProcessingProcessorOptions.PauseAfterEachWorkItem
member.summary: Pause after each work item is migrated

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Processors.WorkItemPostProcessingProcessorOptions.WorkItemCreateRetryLimit
member.summary: **beta** If set to a number greater than 0 work items that fail to save will retry after a number of seconds equal to the retry count. This allows for periodic network glitches not to end the process.

member.name: T:MigrationTools.Processors.WorkItemUpdateAreasAsTagsProcessor
member.summary: A common issue with older *TFS/Azure DevOps* instances is the proliferation of `Area Paths`. With the use of `Area Path` for `Teams` and the addition of the `Node Name` column option these extensive tag hierarchies should instad be moved to tags.

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Processors.WorkItemUpdateAreasAsTagsProcessorOptions.AreaIterationPath
member.summary: This is a required parameter. That define the root path of the iteration. To get the full path use `\`

member.name: P:MigrationTools._EngineV1.Configuration.Processing.TestPlansAndSuitesMigrationProcessorOptions.OnlyElementsWithTag
member.summary: The tag name that is present on all elements that must be migrated. If this option isn't present this processor will migrate all.

member.name: P:MigrationTools._EngineV1.Configuration.Processing.TestPlansAndSuitesMigrationProcessorOptions.TestPlanQuery
member.summary: Filtering conditions to decide whether to migrate a test plan or not. When provided, this partial query is added after `Select * From TestPlan Where` when selecting test plans. Among filtering options, `AreaPath`, `PlanName` and `PlanState` are known to work. There is unfortunately no documentation regarding the available fields.

member.name: P:MigrationTools._EngineV1.Configuration.Processing.TestPlansAndSuitesMigrationProcessorOptions.RemoveAllLinks
member.summary: ??Not sure what this does. Check code.

member.name: P:MigrationTools._EngineV1.Configuration.Processing.TestPlansAndSuitesMigrationProcessorOptions.MigrationDelay
member.summary: ??Not sure what this does. Check code.

member.name: P:MigrationTools._EngineV1.Configuration.Processing.TestPlansAndSuitesMigrationProcessorOptions.RemoveInvalidTestSuiteLinks
member.summary: Indicates whether the configuration for node structure transformation should be taken from the common enricher configs. Otherwise the configuration elements below are used
Remove Invalid Links, see https://github.com/nkdAgility/azure-devops-migration-tools/issues/178

member.name: P:MigrationTools._EngineV1.Configuration.Processing.WorkItemBulkEditProcessorOptions.WIQLQuery
member.summary: A work item query based on WIQL to select only important work items. To migrate all leave this empty. See [WIQL Query Bits](#wiql-query-bits)
member.default: AND [Microsoft.VSTS.Common.ClosedDate] = '' AND [System.WorkItemType] NOT IN ('Test Suite', 'Test Plan','Shared Steps','Shared Parameter','Feedback Request')

member.name: P:MigrationTools._EngineV1.Configuration.Processing.WorkItemBulkEditProcessorOptions.WorkItemIDs
member.summary: A list of work items to import

member.name: P:MigrationTools._EngineV1.Configuration.Processing.WorkItemBulkEditProcessorOptions.FilterWorkItemsThatAlreadyExistInTarget
member.summary: This loads all of the work items already saved to the Target and removes them from the Source work item list prior to commencing the run. While this may take some time in large data sets it reduces the time of the overall migration significantly if you need to restart.

member.name: P:MigrationTools._EngineV1.Configuration.Processing.WorkItemBulkEditProcessorOptions.PauseAfterEachWorkItem
member.summary: Pause after each work item is migrated

member.name: P:MigrationTools._EngineV1.Configuration.Processing.WorkItemBulkEditProcessorOptions.WorkItemCreateRetryLimit
member.summary: **beta** If set to a number greater than 0 work items that fail to save will retry after a number of seconds equal to the retry count. This allows for periodic network glitches not to end the process.

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Tools.TfsAttachmentToolOptions.ExportBasePath
member.summary: `AttachmentMigration` is set to true then you need to specify a working path for attachments to be saved locally.

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Tools.TfsAttachmentToolOptions.MaxAttachmentSize
member.summary: `AttachmentMigration` is set to true then you need to specify a max file size for upload in bites. For Azure DevOps Services the default is 480,000,000 bites (60mb), for TFS its 32,000,000 bites (4mb).

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Tools.TfsGitRepositoryToolOptions.Mappings
member.summary: List of work item mappings.

member.name: T:MigrationTools.Tools.TfsNodeStructureTool
member.summary: The TfsNodeStructureToolEnricher is used to create missing nodes in the target project. To configure it add a `TfsNodeStructureToolOptions` section to `CommonEnrichersConfig` in the config file. Otherwise defaults will be applied.

member.name: M:MigrationTools.Tools.TfsNodeStructureTool.ShouldCreateNode(System.String,MigrationTools.Tools.TfsNodeStructureType)
member.summary: Checks node-to-be-created with allowed BasePath's
member.param: The user-friendly path of the source node

member.name: M:MigrationTools.Tools.TfsNodeStructureTool.CheckIsParentOfSelectedBasePath(System.String)
member.summary: Checks whether a path is a parent of a selected base path (meaning we cannot skip it entirely)
member.param: The user-friendly path of the source node
member.returns: A boolean indicating whether the path is a parent of any positively selected base path.

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Tools.TfsNodeStructureToolOptions.Areas
member.summary: Rules to apply to the Area Path. Is an object of NodeOptions e.g. { "Filters": ["*/**"], "Mappings": { "^oldProjectName([\\\\]?.*)$": "targetProjectA$1", } }

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Tools.TfsNodeStructureToolOptions.Iterations
member.summary: Rules to apply to the Area Path. Is an object of NodeOptions e.g. { "Filters": ["*/**"], "Mappings": { "^oldProjectName([\\\\]?.*)$": "targetProjectA$1", } }

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Tools.TfsNodeStructureToolOptions.ShouldCreateMissingRevisionPaths
member.summary: When set to True the susyem will try to create any missing missing area or iteration paths from the revisions.

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Tools.NodeOptions.Filters
member.summary: Using the Glob format you can specify a list of nodes that you want to match. This can be used to filter the main migration of current nodes. note: This does not negate the nees for all nodes in the history of a work item in scope for the migration MUST exist for the system to run, and this will be validated before the migration. e.g. add "migrationSource1\\Team 1,migrationSource1\\Team 1\\**" to match both the Team 1 node and all child nodes.

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Tools.NodeOptions.Mappings
member.summary: Remapping rules for nodes, implemented with regular expressions. The rules apply with a higher priority than the `PrefixProjectToNodes`, that is, if no rule matches the path and the `PrefixProjectToNodes` option is enabled, then the old `PrefixProjectToNodes` behavior is applied.

member.name: T:MigrationTools.Tools.TfsRevisionManagerTool
member.summary: The TfsRevisionManagerTool manipulates the revisions of a work item to reduce the number of revisions that are migrated.

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Tools.TfsRevisionManagerToolOptions.ReplayRevisions
member.summary: You can choose to migrate the tip only (a single write) or all of the revisions (many writes). If you are setting this to `false` to migrate only the tip then you should set `BuildFieldTable` to `true`.

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Tools.TfsRevisionManagerToolOptions.MaxRevisions
member.summary: Sets the maximum number of revisions that will be migrated. "First + Last N = Max". If this was set to 5 and there were 10 revisions you would get the first 1 (creation) and the latest 4 migrated.

member.name: T:MigrationTools.Tools.TfsTeamSettingsTool
member.summary: The TfsUserMappingTool is used to map users from the source to the target system. Run it with the ExportUsersForMappingContext to create a mapping file then with WorkItemMigrationContext to use the mapping file to update the users in the target system as you migrate the work items.

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Tools.TfsTeamSettingsToolOptions.MigrateTeamSettings
member.summary: Migrate original team settings after their creation on target team project

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Tools.TfsTeamSettingsToolOptions.UpdateTeamSettings
member.summary: Reset the target team settings to match the source if the team exists

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Tools.TfsTeamSettingsToolOptions.MigrateTeamCapacities
member.summary: Migrate original team member capacities after their creation on the target team project. Note: It will only migrate team member capacity if the team member with same display name exists on the target collection otherwise it will be ignored.

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Tools.TfsTeamSettingsToolOptions.Teams
member.summary: List of Teams to process. If this is `null` then all teams will be processed.

member.name: T:MigrationTools.Tools.TfsUserMappingTool
member.summary: The TfsUserMappingTool is used to map users from the source to the target system. Run it with the ExportUsersForMappingContext to create a mapping file then with WorkItemMigrationContext to use the mapping file to update the users in the target system as you migrate the work items.

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Tools.TfsUserMappingToolOptions.IdentityFieldsToCheck
member.summary: This is a list of the Identiy fields in the Source to check for user mapping purposes. You should list all identiy fields that you wan to map.

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Tools.TfsUserMappingToolOptions.UserMappingFile
member.summary: This is the file that will be used to export or import the user mappings. Use the ExportUsersForMapping processor to create the file.

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Tools.TfsWorkItemLinkToolOptions.FilterIfLinkCountMatches
member.summary: Skip validating links if the number of links in the source and the target matches!

member.name: P:MigrationTools.Tools.TfsWorkItemLinkToolOptions.SaveAfterEachLinkIsAdded
member.summary: Save the work item after each link is added. This will slow the migration as it will cause many saves to the TFS database.
